news.title: Moving into 2005
news.summary: The last GWN has shown us what an entire year can bring to a distribution such as Gentoo. We have grown, expanded, and evolved, yet we remained the same flexible distribution that we always were. We would like to thank everyone involved for all their efforts, wish them the best for 2005, and hope that we can continue to work closely to improve Gentoo even more.

p.b: The last GWN has shown us what an entire year can bring to a distribution such as Gentoo. We have grown, expanded, and evolved, yet we remained the same flexible distribution that we always were. We would like to thank everyone involved for all their efforts, wish them the best for 2005, and hope that we can continue to work closely to improve Gentoo even more.

body.p: First of all, we would like to thank you, the Gentoo user, for your continuous belief in Gentoo. It is because of the high requirements that you have that we innovate. Keep raising the bar, and we will keep improving our distribution. We welcome all feedback, all bugreports <http://bugs.gentoo.org>, all thoughts, and all ideas <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/glep/index.xml> for improvement.

We would like to thank our community for their everlasting dynamism. Thanks to them our forums <http://forums.gentoo.org> are a well-known source for fast and accurate support. Thanks to them, our mailinglists <http://www.gentoo.org/main/en/lists.xml> are filled with ideas and productive discussions. It is for our community that we live and we are grateful for the faith that the community has in us.

We would like to thank Daniel Robbins for the wonderful distribution that he created and shaped, and for the official Gentoo Store <http://store.gentoo.org> he currently runs. It is because of his vision that Gentoo exists. We wish him and his family the best for 2005.

We would like to thank all Package Maintainers <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/metastructure/herds/herds.xml> for their efforts to keep our Portage tree <http://packages.gentoo.org> up to date and filled with amazing software titles. These developers are sometimes under great pressure to update their package, yet they continue to work with dedication and precision.

We would like to thank all Porting Teams <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/base/index.xml> for their constant efforts to get Gentoo to run on various architectures. Thanks to your actions, we have support for x86, PowerPC, PowerPC64, Sparc64, MIPS, AMD64, HPPA and Alpha with work on the way for ARM, and IA64.

We would like to thank the Portage developers <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/portage/index.xml> for their innovative approach to software management and maintenance. With each new release we find advancements on existing actions and new features. Every time we again find groundbreaking improvements implemented in this core application, we must remember that these developments are made by people who are giving their time to make our computer experience better.

We would like to thank the Documentation developers <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/gdp/index.xml> for their everlasting work on the successful documentation that Gentoo produces, and the translation teams for the tremendous work they put in the internationalisation of our documentation. You guide our users through the wonderful world of Gentoo - keep up the good job!

We would like to thank the Infrastructure developers <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/infrastructure/index.xml>, and mirror admins who keep our distribution running. The results of their endeavours are visible every day by the availability of our website, forums, bugtracking, mailinglist, mirrors, CVS server, etc. Not everybody knows that this is a full-time job. Thank you very much.

We would like to thank everyone involved in our Release Engineering process <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/releng/index.xml> for the howling energy they put in each new release, in the time-consuming testing and verification of the release media, and the perpetual support through various channels for our LiveCDs. Our appreciation goes with you and your work.

We would like to thank the Development Relations project <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/devrel/index.xml> for their hard work in recruitment, developer training, and their governing hand which resolves disputes between developers time and time again. Your indispensable work is frequently target of flames, yet we can't thank you enough for your perseverance without which Gentoo would stall. Thank you very much.

We would like to thank the developers that take part in the diverse amount of Projects <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/index.xml> that improve Gentoo on several fields, ranging from Desktop experience <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/desktop/index.xml> over the Security <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/security/index.xml> and Hardened <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/hardened/index.xml> initiatives to the ongoing maintenance and development of kernel trees <http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/kernel/index.xml>.

We would like to thank the GWN crew for their unceasing dynamism and never-ending work they put in each Weekly Newsletter <http://www.gentoo.org/news/en/gwn/gwn.xml>. Your work is frequently the source of information that our users consult for the Gentoo hilights and related news. You always work under pressure to get the next release available for the next deadline. Thank you very much.

We would like to thank all upstream developers, without whom this project would be impossible. It is you who make GNU/Linux possible, and you who develop the various packages included within Gentoo. Thank you.

We would like to thank our Sponsors <http://www.gentoo.org/main/en/sponsors.xml> for their trust in Gentoo which help us improve and maintain the distribution we all love. Their contributions help us to remain a top-distribution, now and later.

And finally, we would like to thank everyone we forgot to mention who contributed to Gentoo in many, many ways. You are truely what gives a Free Software project it's appealing charm. Thank you very much.
And of course, our best wishes for 2005 to all of you!
